thread.title: No. 4 Baylor finds foul trouble in loss at Texas Tech
thread.title_full: No. 4 Baylor finds foul trouble in loss at Texas Tech

title: No. 4 Baylor finds foul trouble in loss at Texas Tech
text:
Let friends in your social network know what you are reading about Facebook Email No. 4 Baylor finds foul trouble in loss at Texas Tech The Bears fell 84-78, providing another roadblock in their quest to win the Big 12 title. Post to Facebook No. 4 Baylor finds foul trouble in loss at Texas Tech The Bears fell 84-78, providing another roadblock in their quest to win the Big 12 title. Check out this story on USATODAY.com: http://usat.ly/2kEv9rQ Cancel Send A link has been sent to your friend's email address. Posted! A link has been posted to your Facebook feed. Join the Nation's Conversation To find out more about Facebook commenting please read the Conversation Guidelines and FAQs No. 4 Baylor finds foul trouble in loss at Texas Tech USA TODAY Sports Published 9:11 p.m. ET Feb. 13, 2017 | Updated 2 minutes ago Texas Tech guard Keenan Evans (12) attempts a shot against Baylor in the first half. (Photo: Michael C. Johnson, USA TODAY Sports) CONNECT COMMENT EMAIL MORE 
Baylor emerged victorious in a tight battle with Texas Tech in the teams' last meeting in Waco. 
In the Red Raiders' home gym on Monday night, the No. 4 Bears found themselves on the losing end of a tight game that Texas Tech opened up late. 
Texas Tech defeated foul-plagued Baylor 84-78 to give the Bears their fourth loss of the season. 
Starting guard Manu Lecomte fouled out with over seven minutes remaining, and fellow starter Ishmail Wainright fouled out with under a minute to go. As a team, Baylor finished with 32 fouls. 
Texas Tech improved to 17-9 on the season (5-8 in Big 12 Conference play), picking up their second top-10 home win of the season. 
Baylor fell to 22-4 overall, and, more importantly, the Bears' loss dropped them to 9-4 in the Big 12, providing another roadblock in their attempts to wrestle the Big 12 regular-season championship away from Kansas. The Jayhawks, who are seeking their 13th consecutive Big 12 title, are 10-2 in the Big 12 entering their game later Monday against West Virginia. Facebook Posted!
